response.answer_text: If you mean in WWII, one was to “require” certain companies to convert to war production. Example: before the war there were some 10 typewriter manufacturers in the US. Once the war started, there was only one — IBM. The rest were making parts for military use. Edit. I remember during the Vietnam war a club I was working at wanted a new diving board for the pool. I recommended Duraflex. I was told the company had stopped making diving boards and was now making airplane wings.
